abstract: Case of Ulster Correctional Facility guard Michael Bukowski, who still works at prison despite facing criminal assault charge for his treatment of prisoner Ramon Fabian in 2014, offers example of extensive protections corrections officers have in New York State; although state has tried to fire 30 prison guards since 2010, it has only succeeded 8 times, due to complicated arbitration process mandated by union.
lead_paragraph: The case of a corrections officer who injured an inmate and lied about it, but who an arbitrator found could return to work after a 120-day suspension, illustrates a broader problem.

headline.main: Guarding the Prison Guards: New York State’s Troubled Disciplinary System
headline.print_headline: Abused Inmates, Strong Unions and Hard-to-Fire Prison Guards
